alert.note: Alert for Clarendon (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 05 at 7:24PM EDT until April 05 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN CLARENDON COUNTY... At 723 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Summerton, or 10 miles southwest of Manning, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This dangerous storm will be near... Santee Cooper Regional Airport around 730 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Davis Station, St. Paul and Paxville. This includes Interstate 95 between mile markers 104 and 118. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to an interior room or closet on the lowest floor of a sturdy building immediately. Being in a vehicle during a tornado is not safe. Drive to the closest sturdy building and move to an interior room or closet on the lowest floor. As a last resort, abandon your car and seek shelter in a ditch or low lying area away from trees. Do not seek shelter under highway overpasses.
